item.title: Go: Channel Might Lead to Goroutine Leaks
item.author: loommii
item.description: Detailed explanation of why Channels in Go might cause Goroutine leaks and their solutions.

item.title: Go: GPM Quantity Limits
item.author: loommii
item.description: Detailed explanation of the quantity limits in Go's GPM model.

item.title: Go: Are Maps Concurrency-Safe?
item.author: loommii
item.description:
Conclusion

Concurrent reads are safe, but concurrent writes are not safe.

item.title: Locks
item.author: loommii
item.description: In concurrent computing, computers are highly likely to encounter data corruption issues. Therefore, “locks” are introduced to solve this type of problem. Common locks: Mutex, Spinlock, Read-Write Lock, Pessimistic Lock, Optimistic Lock.
